title: Resume
text:
Work Experience




Functional Trait Technician, Damschen Lab | Madison, WI | Jun. 2025 - Present
- Collected biomass and plant community data in dozens of prairie restoration sites across Wisconsin
- Coordinated with a small team to accomplish prairie seed collection trips in Missouri, Kansas, and Illinois
- Streamlined seed processing techniques for large-scale NRCS seeding study






Line Cook and Catering Chef, Garver Events | Madison, WI | Jul. 2020 - Jan. 2025
- Worked on the line, cooking and assembling food for made-to-order dishes in American-style small restaurant
- Catered for 300-person weddings and corporate events
- Learned to work under high stress, collaborate with coworkers, and efficiently manage time






Crew Member, Northwest Youth Corps | Eugene, OR | Jan. 2022 - Jul. 2022
- Contracted by US Forest Service and non-profits to perform fire prevention and restoration, fence construction, trail restoration, invasive species removal
- Collaborated within five member team to efficiently complete projects
- Gained complex thinking, situational awareness, teamwork, time management, and leadership skills

title: Resume
text:
Research Experience




Undergrad Researcher, Vander Zanden Lab, UW-Madison Center for Limnology | Jan. 2023 - May 2023
- Studied the effectiveness of replicating cyanobacteria-zebra mussel interactions in mesocosms as a framework for future experiments
- Designed and implemented three experiments to measure nutrient cycling, cyanobacteria growth, and zebra mussel filtration dynamics in mesocosms
- Presented findings at campus-wide undergraduate research symposium

title: Resume
text:
On Campus Involvement




Cofounder & Outreach Director, Environmental Science Club | Jan 2024 - Present
- Major contributor to establishing the club and writing the club constitution
- Coordinated and facilitated two guest speakers at club meetings during the first semester to provide career and research advice Energy Team






Member, Helios Club | Jan. 2023 - Present
- Collaborated with UW Madison maintenance to retrofit more than 400 lightbulbs in Four Lakes Dining Hall
- Partnered with University Dining to upgrade dining hall fume hoods, saving over $60,000 per year on electricity






Team Member, RE-volv Club | Sep. 2023 - May 2024
- Contacted ten local nonprofits on behalf of RE-volv to encourage them to pursue solar on their buildings, with financing assistance from RE-volv
- Organized three outreach events to raise awareness and support for RE-volv and solar power on campus

title: Ian Beilfuss
text: Hello! I’m Ian, welcome to my portfolio. I study environmental science and cartography & geographic information systems at the University of Wisconsin - Madison. Feel free to browse my cartography, photography, or read my blog to learn about my semester abroad in Prague.

title: V: Custom Tileset
text:
For this project, I created a custom tileset in MapBox Studio based on V for Vendetta, a 1982 graphic novel written by Alan Moore and illustrated by David Lloyd, and the 2005 film adaptation, directed by James McTeigue.
The tileset uses fonts and colors drawn directly from the graphic novel and film to mimic the muted, noir aesthetic of V for Vendetta. Additionally, I brought in pictorial elements from the graphic novel, including the Guy Faux mask as a city indicator and an explosion to cover the city’s extent. More details on the design choices I implemented can be found in the explainer below. 






View the Explainer in a New Tab

title: The Cost of Billion-Dollar Droughts
text: This map was created for a lab assignment in Geography 370: Introduction to Cartography at UW-Madison. The goal of the lab was to create a choropleth map to visualize state spending on drought disasters over the past half century, especially as drought frequency increases due to climate change. I used data from the National Atmospheric and Oceanic Administration and the Bureau of Economic Analysis. GIS analysis was completed in ArcGIS Pro and design enhancements made in Adobe Illustrator.

title: Mapping Africa’s Physical Geography
text: This map was created for a lab assignment in Geography 370: Introduction to Cartography at UW-Madison. The goal of the lab was to create a reference map of Africa including all 55 Capital cities, 47 additional cities, 10 marine areas, 5 major rivers, and 55 natural landscape features. I used Adobe Illustrator for a significant portion of this lab to organize all of the labels in a coherent way that maximized clarity. The final reference map is shown below along with the initial version exported from ArcGiS Pro before any label styling and adjustments were completed.
